titleStmt.title: A sermon preached at Walden in Essex, May 29th. At the interring of the corps of the right Honorable Susanna, Countesse of Suffolke. Being a modest and short narration of some remarable passages in the holy life and death of that memorable lady. Who dyed May 19th. 1649. / By Edw: Rainbowe. D.D.
titleStmt.author: Rainbowe, Edward, 1608-1684.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed W. Wilson, for Gabriel Bedell, M. M[eighen] and T. C[ollins] and are to be sold at their shop at the Middle Temple-Gate,

notesStmt.note: Collins's and Meighen's names from Wing.
Variant: title page lacks the words "Being a modest .. lady.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: their shop at the Middle Temple-Gate
